title: Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission Sends Letter of Appreciation to Experts from Our Institute-College of Economic and Social Development
content: Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission Sends Letter of Appreciation to Experts from Our Institute-College of Economic and Social Development  HOME About CESDMission and VisionAdministrationVisit CESD Academic ProgramsDoctoral ProgramsMaster’s ProgramsInternational Collaboration Programs Research & FacultyAcademic AreaResearch ProgressCommunity ImpactFaculty Members Alumni CommunityAlumni AssociationAlumni EventsBenefits & Services中文Nankai University in Tianjin of China NKU College of Economic and Social Development 中文About CESDMission and VisionAdministrationVisit CESDAcademic ProgramsDoctoral ProgramsMaster’s ProgramsInternational Collaboration ProgramsResearch & FacultyAcademic AreaResearch ProgressCommunity ImpactFaculty MembersAlumni CommunityAlumni AssociationAlumni EventsBenefits & ServicesHOME         /         News         /         ContentJan 18 2025Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission Sends Letter of Appreciation to Experts from Our InstituteRecently, the Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission sent a letter of appreciation to the Nankai University Institute for Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Coordinated Development, expressing sincere thanks to Professors Liu Binglian, Li Lanbing, Zhou Mi, and Zhang Gui for their intellectual contributions to the region’s coordinated development efforts. The commission also expressed its desire to further strengthen cooperation with our institute and jointly advance deeper and more effective implementation of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development strategy.Over the past decade, our institute’s regional economics discipline has been deeply engaged in serving major national strategies. In support of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei initiative, our scholars have leveraged their expertise to conduct forward-looking and targeted research, offering practical and actionable policy recommendations, many of which have been adopted by relevant government departments.Our regional economics team also actively supports local economic development. We have delivered dozens of training sessions for municipal officials on Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development, organized major conferences for topic discussions and in-depth research, and promoted research outcomes through major newspapers, journals, and national media platforms such as CCTV.In the new year, our institute remains committed to supporting this key national strategy, further enhancing our role as a university think tank, and contributing to the high-quality economic and social development of the region.Related newsSep 05 2023The 20th anniversary of the International Collaboration ProgramsOct 08 2024Alumni Participate in the Nankai 105th Anniversary Special MarathonSep 26 2024The 2024 Opening Ceremony for the Collaborative Education Program between development efforts. The commission also expressed its desire to further strengthen cooperation with our institute and jointly advance deeper and more effective implementation of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development strategy.Over the past decade, our institute’s regional economics discipline has been deeply engaged in serving major national strategies. In support of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei initiative, our scholars have leveraged their expertise to conduct forward-looking and targeted research, offering practical and actionable policy recommendations, many of which have been adopted by relevant government departments.Our regional economics team also actively supports local economic development. We have delivered dozens of training sessions for municipal officials on Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development, organized major conferences for topic discussions and in-depth research, and promoted research outcomes through major newspapers, journals, and national media platforms such as CCTV.In the new year, our institute remains committed to supporting this key national strategy, InstituteJan 18 2025Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission Sends Letter of Appreciation to Experts from Our InstituteRecently, the Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission sent a letter of appreciation to the Nankai University Institute for Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Coordinated Development, expressing sincere thanks to Professors Liu Binglian, Li Lanbing, Zhou Mi, and Zhang Gui for their intellectual contributions to the region’s coordinated development efforts. The commission also expressed its desire to further strengthen cooperation with our institute and jointly advance deeper and more effective implementation of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development strategy.Over the past decade, our institute’s regional economics discipline has been deeply engaged in serving major national strategies. In support of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei initiative, our scholars have leveraged their expertise to conduct forward-looking and targeted research, offering practical and actionable policy recommendations, many of which have been adopted by relevant government departments.Our regional economics team also actively supports local economic development. We have delivered dozens of training sessions for municipal officials on Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei coordinated development, organized major conferences for topic discussions and in-depth research, and promoted research outcomes through major newspapers, journals, and national media platforms such as CCTV.In the new year, our institute remains committed to supporting this key national strategy, further enhancing our role as a university think tank, and contributing to the high-quality economic and social development of the region.Related newsSep 05 2023The 20th anniversary of the International Collaboration ProgramsOct 08 2024Alumni Participate in the Nankai 105th Anniversary Special MarathonSep 26 2024The 2024 Opening Ceremony for the Collaborative Education Program between Nankai University and Flinders University in Australia was Grandly HeldSep 25 2024The Institute of Economics and Social Development Hosts Orientation for the Class of 2024Jun 19 2024Visit by Springer Nature's Asia-Pacific Editorial Director to Modern Logistics Research CenterRecently, the Tianjin Municipal Development and Reform Commission sent a letter of appreciation to the Nankai University Institute for Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Coordinated Development, expressing sincere thanks to Professors Liu Binglian, Li Lanbing, Zhou Mi, and Zhang Gui for their intellectual contributions to the region’s coordinated development efforts.
